question_sentence: Into which ocean did NASA’s Orion spacecraft splash down this week, marking the conclusion of the historic Artemis I mission?
evidence: The spacecraft completed its 25½-day journey around the moon by splashing down in the Pacific Ocean off Mexico’s Baja California.

question_sentence: Which teams faced off in the 2022 World Cup final?
evidence: Argentina played France on Sunday to determine who won the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

question_sentence: US scientists made a remarkable breakthrough this week. What did their discovery involve?
evidence: For the first time, US scientists successfully produced a nuclear fusion reaction resulting in a net energy gain. The discovery is a massive step forward in a decades-long quest for a new form of clean energy that could eventually power homes and help end dependence on fossil fuels.

question_sentence: According to a new study, Covid-19 vaccinations have saved approximately how many lives across the United States?
evidence: Covid-19 vaccines have kept more than 18 million people out of the hospital and saved more than 3 million lives since first becoming available in December 2020, according to researchers from the Commonwealth Fund and Yale School of Public Health.

question_sentence: Which grocery item are people panic buying across China?
evidence: An unprecedented wave of Covid-19 cases in China has sparked panic buying of fever medicines, pain killers, and even home remedies such as canned peaches.

question_sentence: Which state’s governor recently commuted the sentences for 17 death row inmates?
evidence: Outgoing Oregon Gov. Kate Brown commuted the sentences of 17 inmates, clearing the state’s death row and calling the death penalty “immoral.” The inmates will now spend life in prison without the possibility of parole, according to a statement from her office.

question_sentence: Which country passed a landmark anti-smoking bill this week, banning the sale of tobacco for today’s teens and future generations?
evidence: New Zealand passed a historic bill which bans the sale of tobacco to anyone born on or after January 1, 2009.

question_sentence: The federal government is suing Arizona for creating a makeshift wall to block gaps in the US-Mexico border. What had state officials used to construct it?
evidence: Outgoing Arizona Gov. Doug Ducey, a Republican, is contending with a major lawsuit filed by the Department of Justice after instructing state officials to use shipping containers to fill in gaps along the border.

question_sentence: Which billionaire recently lost his top spot as the richest man in world?
evidence: Elon Musk is no longer the richest person on the planet, dropping to the second spot behind French fashion mogul Bernard Arnault.

question_sentence: In recent weeks, at least seven states have said they will bar public employees from using which social media app on government devices?
evidence: TikTok, the popular short-form video app, is facing growing pushback at the state level over fears users’ personal information could wind up in the hands of the Chinese government.

question_sentence: Where was FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried arrested this week?
Legendary college football coach Mike Leach died this week. He coached at all of these schools except:
According to a new USA TODAY/Suffolk University poll, Republicans favor, 56% to 33%, which candidate over former President Donald Trump?
Which member of K-pop supergroup BTS began his mandatory military service at a boot camp this week?
Which city removed its final public Confederate monument this week?
President Joe Biden signed the "Respect for Marriage Act," this week. What does the historic legislation do at the federal level?
choices: Allows same-sex marriage in every state
Sets new rules for name changes

question_sentence: Comedian Dave Chappelle brought out which person – to a chorus of boos and some cheers – on stage during a show this week?
A new technology soon being tested in Michigan could be the future of powering electric vehicles. What is it?
choices: "Electrified roadways" that charge as you drive
Wind farm dedicated to EV charger power

question_sentence: True or false: President Biden has now released all the once-classified files on John F. Kennedy’s assassination.
Scientists made a major advance this week that could someday create clean, carbon-free power using what energy process?
Cambridge University plans to return which major artefact to its home country?
evidence: The university will return the looted Benin Bronzes to Nigeria. The artefacts were taken by British armed forces during the sacking of Benin City in 1897.

question_sentence: Which country has passed a bill that will ban the sale of tobacco to future generations?
evidence: Under new legislation set to be introduced next year, anyone born on or after 1 January 2009 will be unable to buy tobacco in New Zealand.

question_sentence: Who is now the world’s richest man after Elon Musk dropped from the top spot?
evidence: A dramatic drop in the value of Musk’s shares in Tesla saw Arnault, the chief executive of luxury goods group LVMH, claim the title.

question_sentence: What percentage of El Salvador’s population has been jailed under its ‘iron fist’ anti-gang policy?
evidence: President Nayib Bukele’s crackdown has put the nation in a prolonged state of emergency with important constitutional rights, like due process and freedom of association, being restricted.

question_sentence: In which country was former FTX cryptocurrency boss Sam Bankman-Fried arrested after charges were filed against him in the US?
evidence: Bankman-Fried will appear in court in the Bahamas, according to authorities in the Caribbean, after he was arrested for financial offences against laws in the US and the Bahamas.

question_sentence: Joe Biden has released previously secret FBI files about the assassination of which US president?
evidence: Thousands of classified documents relating to the assassination of John F. Kennedy in 1963 were released this week after Biden vowed to make them available to the public.

question_sentence: Temperatures have plummeted across the UK this week. Where was a record low of -15C recorded?
evidence: Cold weather has caused disruption across the UK this week, with meteorologists issuing warnings of ice and snow as temperatures plummeted way below freezing.

question_sentence: Which member of global K-pop superband BTS is to start his compulsory military service this week?
evidence: BTS plan to reunite in around three years’ time, when all seven members of the South Korean group will have completed their military service.

question_sentence: With France and Argentina set to battle it out on Sunday in the World Cup final, which teams will go head to head for third place?
evidence: After losing out in the semi-finals, Croatia and Morocco will now play each other in the third-place play-off on Saturday.

question_sentence: What percentage of UK adults would like to live to 100, according to a new poll?
evidence: According to a poll by Ipsos, 35% of Britons say they want to live to be 100 years old, while 49% disagree. Men are keener on the idea than women (43% to 28%).
